info.headline: Avalanche Watch issued March 09 at 7:12PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Taos Avalanche Center. The Taos Avalanche Center in Taos has issued a Backcountry Avalanche Watch. * WHAT...The avalanche danger is currently Considerable. Another winter storm may increase the avalanche danger to High at all elevations Thursday, March 10th, 2022. * WHERE...Wheeler Peak Wilderness Area and Columbine Hondo Wilderness above 9500 feet. * WHEN... In effect from Wed 19:00 MST to Thu 08:00 MST. * IMPACTS...Another winter storm is on tap tonight into Thursday, March 10th where we could see an additional 1 to 2 feet of snow and strong winds through mid-day Thursday. This will bring storm totals close to 4 feet of snow in the last week. Large dangerous natural and human-triggered avalanches are likely throughout the day Thursday. * PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Dangerous avalanche conditions exist. Careful snowpack evaluation, cautious route finding and conservative decision-making are essential for travel in the backcountry today. This Avalanche Watch is scheduled to expire at 06:00 March 10th. Check back with the Taos Avalanche Center to see if we extend or upgrade to an Avalanche Warning tomorrow morning. Consult http://www.taosavalanchecenter.org or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
